text:
Hi everyone,
I want to schedule an API request to obtain the feedback submission every certain time.
Is there any way to add time filter into the request?
For now I’m getting everything and filtering on my own, but I don’t want to block your API and is not the best way either.
I’ve opened a post as well. Thank you in advance:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Filter-API-Request-by-timestamp/m-p/513614#M47924>

Following this,
I would like to ask as well if there is any way to get the owner of a contact by using the contact endpoint API.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Get-Owner-of-a-Contact-by-Contact-API-Endpoint/m-p/513658#M47929>

Thank you in advance.

Hello

Is there a way to obtain the folder of a List, I dont see it on the API. I want to know to what folder the list belongs to, it seems there is a "parentFolderID" on the response but it is always null.  Any ideas?
Hi Mohit, im not sure but it seems its a problem on the data you are uploading. You have to convert it to byte[] first
Also, you are storing the file as "jpg", of course you will see that if you open it with Notepad, try opening it as an image

Hi, I'm building an application with a crm card extension and have some questions regarding the response format?
in the v3 response format the id of the section is defined as a string and still the card will not load unless the id can be parsed to an integer? I can not find any schema for this response format (apart from the example) and no motivation why this limit exists?

Does anyone know if there is any more detailed documentation available for the CRM v3 import endpoints?  The overview has a couple examples, but the actual request format for creating a new import doesn't seem to be documented fully (i.e. what fields are available, valid values, etc).  It's also rather unclear if running an import full of existing contacts will update those contacts, or simply return a bunch of conflict errors.

<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs>
<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python>

note that the client libraries are actually auto-generated (OpenAPI spec) which means that they’ll share pretty much the same payloads.

The node library for example has an import example:
```<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs#example-import-contacts>```
Also if you click “Endpoints” on this page you’ll get more detail about the import endpoints <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/imports>

The valid are dependant on the type of the target properties
